forkee.name: big-road
forkee.description: The simplist's solution to the mobile-only web story

issue.title: A question about scraping
issue.body: I want to scrap the data from New York Times(https://www.nytimes.com/section/world). But when I finished, I found that I can just scrap 59 entries. However, when I got to the bottom of the website, there is a "SHOW MORE" button and we can see more articles after clicking the button. How can I scrap more data?

comment.body:
> you can try to put `chromedriver` into following locations and see if it works.
> 
> 1. Current working folder -- the one where you started `jupyter notebook`.
> 2. The folder where your `.ipynb` locates.

It still doesn't work....So, I change another website...

issue.title: A question about scraping
issue.body: I want to scrap the data from New York Times(https://www.nytimes.com/section/world). But when I finished, I found that I can just scrap 59 entries. However, when I got to the bottom of the website, there is a "SHOW MORE" button and we can see more articles after clicking the button. How can I scrap more data?

comment.body: > @yaonuan1995 what is your current code and intermediate results? It helps to give the link to your current notebook, so we can start from where you got stuck. This is my notebook before. I have tried the solution from TA, but I found some mistakes of my computer. When I install selenium, I could not put the chromedriver to "/urs/bin". So, I want to know if there is any other solution to click the SHOW MORE button in New York Times website?

issue.title: A question about scraping
issue.body: I want to scrap the data from New York Times(https://www.nytimes.com/section/world). But when I finished, I found that I can just scrap 59 entries. However, when I got to the bottom of the website, there is a "SHOW MORE" button and we can see more articles after clicking the button. How can I scrap more data?

comment.body:
> ## Try the following steps:
> ### 1. Open the Chrome DevTools:
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41979788/47892358-2f013580-de92-11e8-9e21-6de3b61b6abc.png)
> 
> ### 2. Click the SHOW MORE button:
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41979788/47892375-4a6c4080-de92-11e8-8278-2dab1b677b79.png)
> 
> ### 3. Select the elements that appear and check their source codes
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41979788/47892330-0f6a0d00-de92-11e8-8f0c-8e379317062a.png)
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41979788/47892400-74bdfe00-de92-11e8-847c-c4f3b2c21e50.png)
> 
> ### 4. Try scraping them targetedly
> ### Pls. feedback if it works (or does not work)

Sorry, it doesn't work...

However, when I got to the bottom of the website, there is a "SHOW MORE" button and we can see more articles after clicking the button. How can I scrap more data?

issue.title: Question about assignment0
issue.body:
f = open("trade-wars-news1.txt","r+")
content1 = f.read()
f.close()
g = open("trade-wars-news2.txt","r+")
content2 = g.read()
g.close()
h = open("trade-wars-news3.txt","r+")
content3 = h.read()
h.close()
i = open("trade-wars-news4.txt","r+")
content4 = i.read()
i.close()
j = open("trade-wars-news5.txt","r+")
content5 = j.read()
j.close()

A = str.split(content1)
B = str.split(content2)
C = str.split(content3)
D = str.split(content4)
E = str.split(content5)

wordlist = list(A)+list(B)+list(C)+list(D)+list(E)

wordcount = {}
for word in wordlist:
    if word in wordcount:
        wordcount[word] += 1
    else:
        wordcount[word] = 1

wordscount = dict.fromkeys(wordlist,wordcount)

a = sorted(wordscount,key=wordscount.get,reverse=True)





![Uploading 屏幕快照 2018-10-22 上午9.42.59.png…]()

**I don't know why I could not run it, the error type is in the last line,  "not supported between instances of 'dict' and 'dict'".**

comment.body:
> @yaonuan1995
> I think the following two lines have some problem because you 've already gotten the `wordcount` dict, so the first line is meaningless.
> 
> ```python
> wordscount = dict.fromkeys(wordlist,wordcount)
> a = sorted(wordscount,key=wordscount.get,reverse=True)
> ```
> 
> you can get the sorted list and the top 15 by the following command
> 
> ```python
> word_sorted = sorted(wordcount.items(),key=lambda d: d[1],reverse=True)
> top15 = word_sorted[:15]
> top15
> ```
> 
> Now, you can try to do a further excercise:
> 
> 1. Build your own stopwords list, removing some stopwords we don't want in the wordlist.
> 
> ```python
> stopwords = ['the','of','to','is','in','that','as','on','with','a','and'....]
> def remove_stopwords(words):
>     processed_word_list = []
>     for word in wordlist:
>         if word ...:
>             processed_word_list....
>     return ...
> 
> ... = remove_stopwords(wordlist)
> ```
> 
> 1. further organise your code for future reuse? you can refer to assignment 0 [guideline](https://github.com/hupili/python-for-data-and-media-communication-gitbook/blob/master/assignments.md#bonus-discussion-or-demo)

Thanks!!!

issue.title: Question about assignment0
issue.body:
f = open("trade-wars-news1.txt","r+")
content1 = f.read()
f.close()
g = open("trade-wars-news2.txt","r+")
content2 = g.read()
g.close()
h = open("trade-wars-news3.txt","r+")
content3 = h.read()
h.close()
i = open("trade-wars-news4.txt","r+")
content4 = i.read()
i.close()
j = open("trade-wars-news5.txt","r+")
content5 = j.read()
j.close()

A = str.split(content1)
B = str.split(content2)
C = str.split(content3)
D = str.split(content4)
E = str.split(content5)

wordlist = list(A)+list(B)+list(C)+list(D)+list(E)

wordcount = {}
for word in wordlist:
    if word in wordcount:
        wordcount[word] += 1
    else:
        wordcount[word] = 1

wordscount = dict.fromkeys(wordlist,wordcount)

a = sorted(wordscount,key=wordscount.get,reverse=True)





![Uploading 屏幕快照 2018-10-22 上午9.42.59.png…]()

**I don't know why I could not run it, the error type is in the last line,  "not supported between instances of 'dict' and 'dict'".**
